SSP usvojila Predlog zakona za borbu protiv korupcije javnih funkcionera

03 Nov 2019, 14:05









Glavni odbor Stranke slobode i pravde (SSP) jednoglasno je danas usvojio predlog Antikorupcijskog zakona za borbu protiv korupcije javnih funkcionera.Predstavljajući predlog zakona na sednici Glavnog odbora SSP održanoj u Zrenjaninu, potpredsednica stranke Marinika Tepić je kazala da je nastao po uzoru na rumunski, po kom je doskorašanja antikorupcijska tužiteljka u toj zemlji Laura Kodruca Keveši, tužila a sudovi su osudili više od 1.250 funkcionera za srednju i visoku korupciju, medju njima i premijera. "Osudjeno je i petoro ministara, 16 poslanika, petoro senatora, 97 gradonačelnika, 32 direktora javnih preduzeća i 497 javnih funkcionera, a poslednji koji je osudjen na više od tri godine zatvora je lider najveće političke organizacije i predsednik donjeg doma rumunskog parlamenta Liviu Dragnea", navela je Tepić. Ocenila je da je u odnosu na Krivični zakonik, koji ima odredbe za krivična dela korupcije, predloženi zakon specifičan u tome što se odnosi isključivo na javne funkcionere. "Ključno je to da se ukoliko se dokažu krivična dela, javni funkcioneri osudjuju na kazne predvidjene Krivičnim zakonikom, ali, uvećane za trećinu ili čak za polovinu", navela je potpredsednica SSP.Ocenila je da je ključni instrument za dokazivanje korupcije to što se predloženim zakonom uspostavlja posebna policija koja je direktno odgovorna antikorupcijskom tužiocu , a ne ministru unutrašnjih poslova."Reč je o sistemu kompilacije, jer u Srbiji postoji Odeljenje za suzbijanje korupcije pri republičkom tužilaštvu i Agencija za borbu korupcije, ali je na njenom čelu direktor a ne tužilac kao što je slučaj u Rumuniji. Ovo bi trebalo da bude dobitna kombinacija i da pravda bude ona koja se oseća u vazduhu, a ne da nepravda bude ona koja se oseća na svakom koraku", rekla je Tepić.Predsednik Stranke slobode i pravde Dragan Djilas rekao je da je to predlog zakona ne samo SSP, već celog Saveza za Srbiju i dodao da će to biti jedan od prvih zakona kojim će se baviti "nova Skupština Srbije".Djilas je najavio i da će uskoro biti predstavljen Predlog zakona o poreklu imovine, koji se neće odnositi samo na političare.

SAA Adopts Bill to Combat Corruption of Public Officials

03 Nov 2019, 13:05









The main committee of the Party for Freedom and Justice (SAA) unanimously adopted today a proposal for the Anti-Corruption Law to Combat Corruption of Public Officials. While presenting the bill at a session of the SAA Main Board held in Zrenjanin, party vice-president Marinika Tepic said it was modeled after the Romanian one. to what extent the anti-corruption prosecutor in that country, Laura Kodruca Kevesi, has sued and the courts have convicted more than 1,250 officials of middle and high corruption, including the prime minister. "Five ministers, 16 MPs, five senators, 97 mayors, 32 directors of public companies and 497 public officials have also been convicted, and the last one who has been sentenced to more than three years in prison is the leader of the largest political organization and the President of the lower house of Romanian Parliament, Liviu Dragne." , said Tepic. She assessed that, in relation to the Criminal Code, which has provisions for criminal offenses of corruption, the proposed law is specific in that it applies exclusively to public officials. "The key thing is that if crimes are proven, public officials are sentenced to penalties under the Criminal Code, but increased by a third or even half," said the SAA vice president. She said that the key instrument for proving corruption is that the proposed The law establishes a special police force that is directly responsible to the anti-corruption prosecutor, not to the Minister of the Interior. "This is a compilation system, because there is a Department for the Suppression of Corruption at the Republic Prosecutor's Office and a Anti-Corruption Agency in Serbia, but it is headed by a director and not by a prosecutor. as in Romania. This should be a winning combination and justice should be felt in the air, not injustice felt at every turn, "said Tepic. President of the Freedom and Justice Party Dragan Djilas he said it was a bill not only of the SAA, but of the entire Alliance for Serbia, adding that it would be one of the first laws to address " the new Serbian Parliament. "Djillas also announced that a Bill on the Origin of Property will be presented shortly, which will not only concern politicians.
